result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin Douglas Angove was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kevin Douglas Angove in court.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
DE advised of rights to an atty, waives right to an Atty.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.
DEF pleads NC to Count 2. Court accepts plea and finds DEF guilty. Court Withholds sentence, DE placed on 1 year probation, court costs of $ 443.00.   complete any counseling deemed appropriate by agent
Report to probation by 4:00 PM today.
Ct #1 is dismissed but read in.

Defendant Kevin Douglas Angove in court without an attorney.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court addresses DEF regarding lack of attorney.
DEF: unable to afford, would like to speak with ADA again.
Court: will allow one more opportunity to work out resolution with ADA Marcoux.
ADA Marcoux: is willing to speak with DEF and will have DEF sign attorney waiver form.

  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 5, 2016 at 11:00 am.
HEARING SET FOR 02/09/16 REMOVED FROM CALENDAR AT REQUEST OF PARTIES AS DE WISHES TO OBTAIN COUNSEL - SC SET FOR 03/01/16 AT 11:00 AM AT WHICH TIME DE SHALL APPEAR WITH HIS ATTORNEY.  mak
